nodes.bodyText:
in theory the column is nullable:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/resources/db/changelog/db.changelog-RDM-8747.xml
    
    
         Line 8
      in
      95a9061
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <constraints nullable="true"/>
do we need this if check? if supplementary_data is not in the request it will be set to null right?

rather than adding checks in multiple places checking if supp data is an array, we could validate that once at the controller level where we check the validity of the request:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/search/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchQueryHelper.java
    
    
         Line 31
      in
      17f3cbe
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ElasticsearchRequest validateAndConvertRequest(String jsonSearchRequest) { 
        
    
  


and then assume it's an array here. We should also document in Swagger that it has to be an array if we haven't done it yet

this is part of the request validation, so it would be better here probably?

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/search/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchQueryHelper.java
    
    
         Line 31
      in
      17f3cbe
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ElasticsearchRequest validateAndConvertRequest(String jsonSearchRequest) {

better move this to:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/search/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchQueryHelper.java
    
    
         Line 31
      in
      17f3cbe
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ElasticsearchRequest validateAndConvertRequest(String jsonSearchRequest) {

this is now doing more than simply converting to Json. Shall we rename to:
toFinalRequest() or sim?

commit.message: RDM-9374 - Return supplementary data by default for standard requests

nodes.bodyText: not 100% sure but would it make the code simpler to have this as an List<String>? so that clients don't have to work with the cumbersome Jakson API

commit.message:
RDM-9374 - Review comment renaming

Co-authored-by: Mario Paniccia <mario.paniccia@hmcts.net>

nodes.bodyText:
Contrary to before, all requests DataStore generates to ES now will have the _source field right?
Whereas before only when:
elasticsearchRequest.hasSourceFields()
wondering whether _source will make searches performance worse 🤔
